I'm now deep in the implementation of `TeamWheel.jsx`. After some thought, I've decided to move the intricate rotation logic to a separate CSS file, `TeamWheel.css`, to keep my JSX clean. I'm focusing on the CSS file now. The goal is a responsive design: absolute positioning with rotations for desktop and flex/grid for smaller screens. I've already determined the angle for each member and a suitable radius for the circle. Next is writing the CSS.


**Developing CSS Structure**

The CSS file is shaping up nicely. I've defined the `.team-wheel-container`, `.wheel-center`, and `.wheel-item` styles. Positioning, sizing, and basic styling are in place. The crucial transform logic is next: calculating the rotation and translation for each team member based on their index to position them in a circle. I also added some nice touches like `backdrop-filter` and `box-shadow` to the center element.


**Implementing Component Structure**

My focus has shifted to the `TeamWheel.jsx` file. I've designed a CSS structure with a `.wheel-spoke` container to handle the positioning and rotation calculations, along with a `.wheel-card-wrapper` to hold the content. The aim is to create visual spokes emanating from the center. I've also begun to consider a simplified approach, pre-calculating the positions in JavaScript. Next step: the JSX, and I must not forget to include the images for my team members.

+ }
+ 
+ @keyframes orbit-spin {
+   from { transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(0deg); }
+   to { transform: translate(-50%, -50%) rotate(360deg); }
+ }
+ 
+ .wheel-card-position {
+   position: absolute;
+   top: 50%;
+   left: 50%;
+   /* transform set via inline styles */
+   transition: all 0.5s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1);
+   width: 0;
+   height: 0;
+   z-index: 20;
+ }
+ 
+ .wheel-card {
+   position: relative;
+   transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
+   width: 260px;
+   padding: 1.5rem;
+   text-align: center;
+   transition: all 0.3s ease;
+   cursor: pointer;
+ }

+   content: &#39;&#39;;

+   top: 50%;

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: src/components/TeamWheel.jsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 86, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,86 @@
- 
+ import React, { useState, useEffect } from &#39;react&#39;;
+ import &#39;./TeamWheel.css&#39;;
+ 
+ const TeamWheel = ({ members }) =&gt; {
+   const [activeMember, setActiveMember] = useState(null);
+ 
+   // Calculate positions for the wheel
+   const radius = 300; // Distance from center
+   const totalMembers = members.length;
+   const angleStep = (2 * Math.PI) / totalMembers;
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;div className=&quot;team-wheel-wrapper&quot;&gt;
+       {/* Desktop Wheel View */}
+       &lt;div className=&quot;team-wheel-container&quot;&gt;
+         &lt;div className=&quot;wheel-orbit&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
+         &lt;div className=&quot;wheel-center glass&quot;&gt;
+           &lt;div className=&quot;wheel-center-logo&quot;&gt;Frog8&lt;/div&gt;
+           &lt;div className=&quot;wheel-center-text&quot;&gt;Leadership&lt;/div&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+         {members.map((member, index) =&gt; {
+           // Start from top (-PI/2)
+           const angle = index * angleStep - Math.PI / 2;
+           const x = Math.round(radius * Math.cos(angle));
+           const y = Math.round(radius * Math.sin(angle));
+ 
+           return (
+             &lt;div
+               key={index}
+               className={&#96;wheel-card-position&#96;}
+               style={{
+                 transform: &#96;translate(calc(-50% + ${x}px), calc(-50% + ${y}px))&#96;
+               }}
+             &gt;
+               &lt;div className=&quot;glass wheel-card&quot;&gt;
+                 &lt;div className=&quot;wheel-card-image&quot;&gt;
+                   {member.image ? (
+                     &lt;img src={member.image} alt={member.name} loading=&quot;lazy&quot; /&gt;
+                   ) : (
+                     &lt;div className=&quot;w-full h-full flex items-center justify-center bg-gray-800 text-green-400&quot;&gt;
+                       &lt;svg viewBox=&quot;0 0 24 24&quot; fill=&quot;none&quot; stroke=&quot;currentColor&quot; className=&quot;w-10 h-10&quot;&gt;
+                         &lt;path strokeLinecap=&quot;round&quot; strokeLinejoin=&quot;round&quot; strokeWidth={2} d=&quot;M16 7a4 4 0 11-8 0 4 4 0 018 0zM12 14a7 7 0 00-7 7h14a7 7 0 00-7-7z&quot; /&gt;
+                       &lt;/svg&gt;
+                     &lt;/div&gt;
+                   )}
+                 &lt;/div&gt;
+                 &lt;div className=&quot;wheel-card-content&quot;&gt;
+                   &lt;h3&gt;{member.name}&lt;/h3&gt;
+                   &lt;p className=&quot;role&quot;&gt;{member.role}&lt;/p&gt;
+                   &lt;p className=&quot;bio&quot;&gt;{member.bio}&lt;/p&gt;
+                 &lt;/div&gt;
+               &lt;/div&gt;
+             &lt;/div&gt;
+           );
+         })}
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+       {/* Mobile Grid View */}
+       &lt;div className=&quot;team-grid-mobile grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 gap-8 p-4&quot;&gt;
+         {members.map((member, index) =&gt; (
+           &lt;div key={index} className=&quot;glass leader-card&quot;&gt;
+             &lt;div className=&quot;leader-image-wrapper&quot;&gt;
+               {member.image ? (
+                 &lt;img src={member.image} alt={member.name} className=&quot;leader-image&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; /&gt;
+               ) : (
+                 &lt;div className=&quot;leader-image-placeholder&quot;&gt;
+                    &lt;svg viewBox=&quot;0 0 24 24&quot; fill=&quot;none&quot; stroke=&quot;currentColor&quot; strokeWidth=&quot;2&quot; strokeLinecap=&quot;round&quot; strokeLinejoin=&quot;round&quot;&gt;
+                     &lt;path d=&quot;M20 21v-2a4 4 0 0 0-4-4H8a4 4 0 0 0-4 4v2&quot;&gt;&lt;/path&gt;
+                     &lt;circle cx=&quot;12&quot; cy=&quot;7&quot; r=&quot;4&quot;&gt;&lt;/circle&gt;
+                   &lt;/svg&gt;
+                 &lt;/div&gt;
+               )}
+             &lt;/div&gt;
+             &lt;h3 className=&quot;leader-name&quot;&gt;{member.name}&lt;/h3&gt;
+             &lt;p className=&quot;leader-role&quot;&gt;{member.role}&lt;/p&gt;
+             &lt;p className=&quot;leader-bio&quot;&gt;{member.bio}&lt;/p&gt;
+           &lt;/div&gt;
+         ))}
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   );
+ };
+ 
+ export default TeamWheel;
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

The "Leadership Team" section on the **About** page has been updated with a new circular wheel layout and the addition of Sunil Kulkarni.

### Changes Made:
1.  **Added Sunil Kulkarni**: Included in the leadership team with a placeholder bio emphasizing his fintech and BCFI expertise. A placeholder icon is used since no image was available.
2.  **New "Wheel" Layout**:
    *   **Desktop**: Implemented a `TeamWheel` component where team members orbit a central "Leadership" hub. It uses a modern glassmorphism style matching the Frog8 theme.
    *   **Mobile**: Retained a clean, stacked grid layout to ensure readability on smaller screens.
3.  **Component Integration**: Created `src/components/TeamWheel.jsx` and `src/components/TeamWheel.css` to handle the logic and responsive styling, and integrated it into `src/pages/about.astro`.

The section is now fully responsive and maintains the site's professional, dark-themed aesthetic.

---

_**User (2025-11-14 08:14Z)**_

the cards in the center when hovered are merging the detailed text below with the cards that are below

---

_**Agent (model gemini-3-pro, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Analyzing Component Behavior**

I'm currently focused on the `TeamWheel` component and a layout issue. Specifically, when hovering over a central card, the detailed text is overlapping the cards beneath it. I'm thinking about the CSS properties involved to diagnose the problem. Perhaps it's a z-index issue, or something related to positioning.


**Pinpointing the Culprit**

I've located the problematic CSS. The `.wheel-card:hover p.bio` rule uses `position: absolute`, `top: 100%`, and `z-index: 40`. The card's transform is also relevant. I need to consider how this absolute positioning, relative to the card, interacts with the layout. The overlapping suggests the `z-index` might be insufficient, or the container's height is not accommodating the bio.


**Addressing the Overlay Problem**

I'm now zeroing in on increasing the `z-index` of the hovered card. The existing value of 30 on hover seems inadequate. I'll test setting the hovered card's `z-index` to a much higher value, such as 100 or even 1000, to ensure it's on top. Also, I'll need to check if the bio's container has a height that accommodates the bio's expanded text, preventing overflow. I suspect the current fixed width is correct, the z-index is more likely to be the issue.


**Considering Z-Index Strategies**

I'm now contemplating how to handle the z-index hierarchy effectively. The `wheel-card-position` might be the main stacking context, and its siblings, including the hovered card, are stacked in DOM order. Therefore, setting the hovered card's `z-index` within its `wheel-card-position` won't solve the issue. I may need to apply a very high `z-index` to the `wheel-card-position` element or even to the `.TeamWheel` component itself, to ensure the hovered card's bio appears on top of the other cards. Also, I am going to try setting the hovered card's `z-index: 1000`.


**Considering Implementation Options**

I'm now weighing the best approach for solving the overlapping issue. The CSS-only solution using `:has()` for the `wheel-card-position` to raise its `z-index` when a card is hovered looks promising. However, since I already have `activeMember` in the React component state, it might be cleaner to adjust the `z-index` directly within the component, based on the `activeMember` state, for better control and easier maintenance.


**Refining Z-Index Logic**

I'm revisiting the use of `z-index` in conjunction with `position: absolute`. I'm going to start by bumping up the z-index of the parent container to see if that resolves the issue. I am also planning on adding `pointer-events: none` to the `.bio` paragraph to see if that helps at all, in case the mouse events are triggering more problems.


**Implementing Hover State**

I'm now proceeding with modifying the `TeamWheel.jsx` component. I'll add `onMouseEnter` and `onMouseLeave` event handlers to update the `activeMember` state. This will allow dynamic control of the `z-index` of the parent container, ensuring the hovered card always appears on top. I intend to use this state to modify the `z-index` of the parent dynamically, rather than relying solely on CSS.


**Evaluating CSS and JS Strategy**

I'm now determining how to proceed, reviewing both the CSS and React code. My plan is to modify the `TeamWheel.jsx` component to dynamically adjust the z-index. I'll use the `activeMember` state, applying `onMouseEnter` and `onMouseLeave` handlers to control the z-index of the parent `wheel-card-position`, effectively placing the hovered card's bio on top.


</details></think>

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file** • Read file: src/components/TeamWheel.jsx</summary>

</details>
</tool-use>

---

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Refining Z-Index Control**

---

I have addressed the issue where the detailed bio text was merging or overlapping with the cards below it.

### Fixes Implemented:

1.  **Dynamic Z-Index in `TeamWheel.jsx`**:
    *   Added logic to dynamically set the `z-index` of the hovered card's container to `50` (default is `20`). This ensures the active card and its expanded bio always render **on top** of all other cards in the wheel.
    *   Implemented `onMouseEnter` and `onMouseLeave` handlers to track the active member state.

2.  **Enhanced Bio Popup Styling in `TeamWheel.css`**:
    *   Increased the background opacity to `rgba(10, 10, 10, 0.95)` to prevent background elements from "bleeding" through the text.
    *   Added a `backdrop-filter: blur(12px)` for a stronger glass effect that still obscures the content behind it.
    *   Increased the `z-index` of the bio popup to `60` to ensure it sits above its own container and other elements.
    *   Added a stronger shadow for better depth separation.

Now, when you hover over a card, it will pop to the front, and the detailed text will display clearly over any underlying elements without visual merging.
